sprechertext.p: Hi! My name is Wayne and I live in Washington, D. C. It’s the capital of the USA. Guess what? I won a trip around the USA and these are the places I want to visit!

inhalteelement.p: The Grand Canyon is a river valley in the state of Arizona. It is in Grand Canyon National Park, one of the huge national parks where you can see some of America’s most fantastic plants and animals. You can take part in great rafting trips here.
New York is the biggest city in the United States. The Statue of Liberty was a present from France more than 100 years ago.
The US Space and Rocket Center in Huntsville, Alabama has a great collection of rockets and other things from space. Some people call it “the Earth’s largest space museum”.
Native Americans are people who lived in North America before the first Europeans arrived and settled there. Native Americans still live in some parts of the USA.
My favorite sport is American football. I like soccer too, but football is more popular in the USA. I play on my school football team! I’m a big fan of the LA Chargers.

inhalteelement.p: I can understand information about the USA. ✔
Writing about how you use social media

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the blog about Wayne’s trip around the USA.
Hi everyone!

I’m still on vacation, my favorite time of the year! I met the Navajo people in Monument Valley on the weekend. It’s a beautiful place. There are 500 tribes of Native Americans in the USA. The Navajo is one of the largest tribes in the USA.

I was really surprised when I heard that not all Navajo people have internet at home or at school.  A lot of them live in reservations a long way from towns and cities so the internet is important to them. My Navajo friend, Atsa, told me that they are very interested in news from other Native people. Young people use social media for: sharing stories, information and funny videos, keeping in touch with each other, getting news from other reservations and also for posting photos of themselves. I often use social media for the same things. Usually I use my dad’s old laptop, but I bought my own tablet for this trip.

Of course, the Navajo use different websites than me and my friends. I can’t remember the names, but there is one that is the most important website for Native Americans. This website is more interesting than other famous US websites. It’s the best to get the latest information about the Navajo and it’s the least difficult one to use. Newspapers and TV are less popular than the internet for younger Navajo. American newspapers aren’t interested in Native Americans and don’t have many stories about them.

It’s nearly 8:00 p.m. here now, 10:00 p.m. at home in Washington, and we’re going to watch a movie in half an hour. Tomorrow it’s the Grand Canyon! I’ll write about my trip there on Thursday. And next week I’m going to go to the summer camp at Crystal Falls in Michigan.
This is the most exciting summer vacation I’ve ever had! 
Bye!

musterloesung.p: 12:00 Uhr mittags an der Ostküste der USA – 18:00 Uhr in Deutschland
autumn (BE) – fall (AE), biscuit (BE) – cookie (AE), football (BE) – soccer (AE)

Die Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika sind ein sehr großes Land mit mehreren Zeitzonen. Washington D.C. liegt nicht weit von der Ostküste der USA. Wayne befindet sich 5660 km entfernt in Monument Valley. Dort ist es zwei Stunden früher als in Washington D.C. Wenn es 12.00 Uhr mittags an der Ostküste der USA ist, wie spät ist es dann in Deutschland?
Ein paar Wörter unterscheiden sich im britischen und amerikanischen Englisch. Schreibweise und Ausprache sind manchmal auch anders.
Wie lauten die Wörter Herbst, Keks und Fußball in britischen bzw. amerikanischen Englisch? Schlage in einem Wörterbuch nach.

aufgabe.titel: Take the test and find out how media mad1 you are!

aufgabenstellung.p: Start with the first sentence. Is it true? Then go → to the next sentence. Or is it not true? Then go → to the next sentence.

td.p: You spend one or two hours online every day.
You spend too much time online.
You haven’t got many apps on your phone.
You check your messages all the time!
You often meet your friends face-to-face. You don’t send messages or e-mails very often.
You often have video chats with friends and family.
Your parents think that you spend too much time online.
Do you post pictures of yourself online?
Have you ever bought anything online?
You like shopping in shops more than online shopping.
You download2 all your music and listen to it on your phone.
You check for messages just two or three times a day.
You look at pictures of your friends online.
You post lots of pictures of yourself online so everyone can see them.
You love new apps for your phone.
You always check the prices online before you go shopping.
You don’t like video games. Boring!
You’re media mad! You love technology and media and have a lot of fun with it. Too much? Try to stay away from your phone or computer for two or three hours every day!
You’re clever3 with media! You know media can help you a lot, for example to keep in touch with your friends.
You don’t use media very much! But maybe some of your friends could show you how media can help you.

Talking about a summer camp

aufgabenstellung.p: Where are the people? What are they doing? Would you like to be with them? Say why or why not.
“Mrs Price, please can we go rafting on the river?”
“No! For the 200th time, you can’t.”
“But why not?”
“No. I told you. You can’t go. It’s too dangerous.”
“Yes, I know, but we’re not little children. We’ll be very careful!”

Wayne and his three friends Rick, Emma and Tony were at a summer camp which was OK, but didn’t organize very many exciting activities. Stella Price, the camp leader said they had to stay together with the others. After the 43rd song around the fire Wayne and his friends decided to take a raft and paddle down the Colorado River to the Grand Canyon.

Suddenly a helicopter flew behind them. Stella Price was in the helicopter. She had a megaphone and shouted at them to stop, but they just wanted to have fun. What was wrong with that? How many teens were brave enough to go on a rafting trip? Not many, Wayne thought.

The friends arrived at the Crystal Falls. There was so much water. The huge waves were scary. The raft went into the dangerous rapids. Wayne’s heart went crazy. The raft went very fast into the rapids. There were huge waves between the rocks in the middle of the river. The river then fell into a deep hole.

Wayne paddled and tried to fight against the current. He paddled … and paddled … but he couldn’t do it. A huge wave pushed the raft up and over the hole. The raft fell, and then it turned over. Wayne shouted as they all fell out of the raft. He tried to swim but the current pulled him down – deeper and deeper …
“Wake up! Wayne.” Stella Price stood next to him. “Come on. It’s time for breakfast. We don’t have much time. We want to go rafting today.”
Oh no! Wayne thought.

musterloesung.p: I think the people are on a river. They are rafting. They are wearing helmets. I would like to be with them because it looks exciting./I wouldn’t like to be with them because it looks dangerous.

The friends arrived at the Crystal Falls. There was so much water. The huge waves were scary. The raft went into the dangerous rapids. Wayne’s heart went crazy. The raft went very fast into the rapids. There were huge waves between the rocks in the middle of the river. The river then fell into a deep hole.

Wayne paddled and tried to fight against the current. He paddled … and paddled … but he couldn’t do it. A huge wave pushed the raft up and over the hole. The raft fell, and then it turned over. Wayne shouted as they all fell out of the raft. He tried to swim but the current pulled him down – deeper and deeper …
“Wake up! Wayne.” Stella Price stood next to him. “Come on. It’s time for breakfast. We don’t have much time. We want to go rafting today.”
Oh no! Wayne thought.

inhalteelement.p: “Mrs Price, please can we go rafting on the river?”
“No! For the 200th time, you can’t.”
“But why not?”
“No. I told you. You can’t go. It’s too dangerous.”
“Yes, I know, but we’re not little children. We’ll be very careful!”

Wayne and his three friends Rick, Emma and Tony were at a summer camp which was OK, but didn’t organize very many exciting activities. Stella Price, the camp leader said they had to stay together with the others. After the 43rd song around the fire Wayne and his friends decided to take a raft and paddle down the Colorado River to the Grand Canyon.

Suddenly a helicopter flew behind them. Stella Price was in the helicopter. She had a megaphone and shouted at them to stop, but they just wanted to have fun. What was wrong with that? How many teens were brave enough to go on a rafting trip? Not many, Wayne thought.

The friends arrived at the Crystal Falls. There was so much water. The huge waves were scary. The raft went into the dangerous rapids. Wayne’s heart went crazy. The raft went very fast into the rapids. There were huge waves between the rocks in the middle of the river. The river then fell into a deep hole.

Wayne paddled and tried to fight against the current. He paddled … and paddled … but he couldn’t do it. A huge wave pushed the raft up and over the hole. The raft fell, and then it turned over. Wayne shouted as they all fell out of the raft. He tried to swim but the current pulled him down – deeper and deeper …
“Wake up! Wayne.” Stella Price stood next to him. “Come on. It’s time for breakfast. We don’t have much time. We want to go rafting today.”
Oh no! Wayne thought.
In Summer camps können Jugendliche einige Wochen im Sommer verbringen. Dort können sie Neues lernen und erleben. Die camps bieten manchmal spezielle Aktivitäten, wie z.B. Wassersportarten oder Musik.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the information about American sports.
… is the most popular sport in the USA.
Do you know Super Bowl? It’s the most important football match and the most popular sports event of the year in the USA.

American football isn’t the same as football in Germany. In the USA, people call German football soccer. In American football the ball is oval like a rugby ball. Players must be fast and strong. They wear helmets and special clothes. A team can have eleven players on the playing field at the same time.
… is a very popular game for everyone.
In baseball there are two teams, each with nine players: one team throws a small hard ball (called a baseball) and the other team tries to hit it with a bat.

There are baseball teams and competitions in nearly every school in the USA. You don’t need to be tall or strong to play. But the bat is long and the ball is small and hard, so you must have good eyes.
… is the number 3 sport in the USA. A lot of basketball players in the USA are famous like pop stars!
There are two teams with five players each. They try to throw a ball in a basket, and make points against the other team.
Players can bounce the ball and run with it or throw it to other players on the team.
Basketball players are often very tall. But everyone can play basketball. You’ll see tall people and small people playing basketball in parks and playgrounds all over America.
… is a sport that you’ll see at nearly all big sports events in the USA. Cheerleaders dance and jump. It can be dangerous and you have to be fit!

The first cheerleaders were men, but today 95 % of cheerleaders are girls. Their job at matches is to motivate the players and the fans. But there are also cheerleading competitions – cheerleading is a sport.
Cheerleading started in the USA, but is now popular in many countries. There are now about 100,000 cheerleaders all around the world.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the text.
The first thing I saw when I woke up after my accident was my parents. They looked at me. They looked happy and sad at the same time. My mom smiled1.
I wanted to get up but I couldn’t move.
“Hey, what’s wrong with me?” Mom couldn’t speak.
My dad said, “Noah, you’ve had an accident. Don’t you remember2?”
I remembered I was on the way to an American football game. I wanted to cross the street when a car drove down the street very fast. I started to run.
Someone screamed and suddenly everything around me went black.
“OK Dad, I feel fine now. I want to get up. I’m late for the game.”
“Noah, you can’t get up. Your accident was ten days ago. Your legs and your back got hurt when that car hit you.”
It took a moment for me to understand. I couldn’t feel my legs. I looked around and saw a wheelchair on the other side of my bed.
“Mom, Dad, what’s wrong with me?” I asked.
My mom still couldn’t say a word.
Dad told me, “You must be strong now, Noah. You will never walk again.”

I can never play football again! American football was my life! I was a good football player, an important part of my team. I could run very fast, I was strong. And now? My arms still hurt. I need help with a lot of things. My friends come over every day. It’s OK when I can be with them. Usually we have a lot of fun together and sometimes I forget that I’m in a wheelchair. But when they go to football practice, I can’t go with them. I’m so unhappy!
Wow, we won the game against Longview High School. It was a really exciting game! I still can’t believe we won. Longview has one of the best teams.

I’m still in my wheelchair, and I’ll be in a wheelchair for the rest of my life. But it’s a life with football again. Thanks to my friends. They saw some videos on social media about football players in wheelchairs. They showed them to the coach and asked him to give me a chance.
Two days later our coach talked to my parents and me. My parents didn’t like the idea at first.
They thought I wasn’t strong enough. But they saw the videos too. They said yes and I was on the team again.
And did you know that there is something called Wheelchair American Football?
Maybe I’ll try that one day.
1 to smile – lächeln
2 to remember – sich erinnern

tipp.p: Wenn du ein Wort nicht kennst, kannst du versuchen, die Bedeutung aus dem Sinnzusammenhang zu erschließen. Wenn du dir nicht sicher bist, kannst du in einem Wörterbuch nachschlagen.

inhalteelement.p: The first thing I saw when I woke up after my accident was my parents. They looked at me. They looked happy and sad at the same time. My mom smiled1.
I wanted to get up but I couldn’t move.
“Hey, what’s wrong with me?” Mom couldn’t speak.
My dad said, “Noah, you’ve had an accident. Don’t you remember2?”
I remembered I was on the way to an American football game. I wanted to cross the street when a car drove down the street very fast. I started to run.
Someone screamed and suddenly everything around me went black.
“OK Dad, I feel fine now. I want to get up. I’m late for the game.”
“Noah, you can’t get up. Your accident was ten days ago. Your legs and your back got hurt when that car hit you.”
It took a moment for me to understand. I couldn’t feel my legs. I looked around and saw a wheelchair on the other side of my bed.
“Mom, Dad, what’s wrong with me?” I asked.
My mom still couldn’t say a word.
Dad told me, “You must be strong now, Noah. You will never walk again.”

I can never play football again! American football was my life! I was a good football player, an important part of my team. I could run very fast, I was strong. And now? My arms still hurt. I need help with a lot of things. My friends come over every day. It’s OK when I can be with them. Usually we have a lot of fun together and sometimes I forget that I’m in a wheelchair. But when they go to football practice, I can’t go with them. I’m so unhappy!
Wow, we won the game against Longview High School. It was a really exciting game! I still can’t believe we won. Longview has one of the best teams.

I’m still in my wheelchair, and I’ll be in a wheelchair for the rest of my life. But it’s a life with football again. Thanks to my friends. They saw some videos on social media about football players in wheelchairs. They showed them to the coach and asked him to give me a chance.
Two days later our coach talked to my parents and me. My parents didn’t like the idea at first.
They thought I wasn’t strong enough. But they saw the videos too. They said yes and I was on the team again.
And did you know that there is something called Wheelchair American Football?
Maybe I’ll try that one day.

2 to remember – sich erinnern

ebene.titel: Let's go to a summer camp

aufgabe.titel: MEDIATION | Beantworte die Fragen deiner Eltern auf Deutsch.

aufgabenstellung.p: Du hast im Internet eine Webseite über summer camps gesehen und zeigst sie deinen Eltern.
< 1 > Home < 2 > About < 3 > News < 4 > Info
Have the best summer of your life!

li.p: Play tennis, soccer and basketball, try drama or make art!
Live in small wooden cabins with seven other campers – all boys or all girls about the same age.
Stay for one week or more. Lots of children stay for six!
Pay less if you stay for three weeks or more. Bring your brothers and sisters for half price!
You are vegetarian or you have allergies? No problem – our cooks cook good, healthy food for everybody.
The camp is run by fun, young adult camp leaders. (Dear parents, don’t worry: They are all trained in first aid – and a hospital and doctors are only two miles away.)

aufgabenitem.p: Wie lange dauert so ein Feriencamp?

musterloesung.p: eine Woche bis sechs Wochen

aufgabenitem.p: Was kann man alles unternehmen?

musterloesung.p: Tennis, Fußball und Basketball spielen, Theater ausprobieren oder Kunstwerke machen

aufgabenitem.p: Wie wird man untergebracht?

musterloesung.p: in Holzhütten mit sieben anderen Kindern im gleichen Alter, Mädchen und Jungen getrennt

aufgabenitem.p: Das ist bestimmt teuer. Gibt es Sonderangebote?

musterloesung.p: Es kostet weniger, wenn man mindestens drei Wochen bleibt. Geschwister können zum halben Preis mitkommen.

aufgabenitem.p: Wer kümmert sich um euch?

musterloesung.p: junge (erwachsene) Betreuer, die eine Erste-Hilfe-Ausbildung haben

aufgabenstellung.p: Going to a summer camp
Beantworte die Fragen deiner Eltern auf Deutsch.
Hancock, Maine

li.p: Get sporty this summer!
There’s baseball, basketball or American football or try windsurfing, canoeing or stand-up paddle boarding.
Biggest watersports area in the USA! Here you can play beach volleyball next to the water!
Stay two, three or four weeks.
All activities are with adult leaders.
There are campfire programs in the evenings.
Sing karaoke or go on night walks.
Big rooms with six beds, one bathroom for two bedrooms.
Good food, no fast food! Three meals each day and snacks.
Pay less if you bring a brother or a sister.

musterloesung.p: 2, 3 oder 4 Wochen

inhalteelement.p: ✔ I learned something about sports.
Ziel 4: I learned something about sports.

Thanksgiving1 is an important special day in the USA. But the Super Bowl is the most important sports event of the year in the USA, so Super Bowl Sunday in February is also a special day for all American football fans – and most Americans love this sport.

Many fans celebrate this day: They cook special food or have a barbecue; they invite friends and family over. It’s a very big party. About 110 million people watch the football game at home. Of course many people try to see it in the stadium, but a ticket costs about $5,000! And it is not only a game – it is a big show with lots of famous singers and dancers. Only the best singers sing their songs in the halftime2 show.
1 Thanksgiving – Erntedankfest
2 halftime – Halbzeit

inhalteelement.p: ✔ I can pass on information about a summer camp.
Ziel 5: I can pass on information about a summer camp.
Are you interested in sports AND technology? Then spend the summer with us!
In the morning you can do amazing experiments and find out more about your phone. You can also learn how to program a new computer game.
In the afternoon you can try out sports like canoeing, rafting or baseball.
Every night there will be exciting barbecues with campfires, and you stay in a great tent with other boys or girls.

inhalteelement.p: ✔ I can understand a film about a trip to the USA.
Work in groups and write questions for a quiz about the USA. Each group writes eight questions. The groups are the teams when you do the quiz.

aufgabenstellung.zwischenueberschrift: Step 1: Collect ideas and think of your questions.
aufgabenstellung.p: Collect ideas for questions about the USA.
Here are some ideas for questions:

li.p: people?
sport?
cities?
famous person?
flag?
national parks?

aufgabenstellung.zwischenueberschrift: Step 1: Collect ideas and think of your questions.
aufgabenstellung.p: Make a long list with everyone’s ideas. Then look at all the ideas together and make a short list.

inhalteelement.p: Hört euch zunächst alle Ideen an. Gebt jedem die Chance, zu erklären, was er oder sie gemeint hat. Einigt euch auf die Fragen, die ihr stellen wollt. Sie sollten mit W-Wörtern beginnen, also where? what? who?. Ihr sollt keine Fragen stellen, die mit ja oder nein beantwortet werden können.

aufgabenstellung.zwischenueberschrift: Step 2: Write your questions and check the answers.

li.p: Each student writes a card with one question and the answer on the back.
Another student checks the English. A third student checks that the answer is correct.
Each student in the team has to read one or more questions. Think of the order of the questions and practise before you do the quiz.

aufgabenstellung.zwischenueberschrift: Step 3: Get ready for the quiz.

li.p: When can you do the quiz?
Who can start/finish the quiz?
Which team reads its questions first?

tipp.p: Jedes Team kann eine Flagge vorbereiten.
Ihr könnt auch ein Maskottchen mitbringen.

inhalteelement.p: Lest die Fragen laut und deutlich vor. Seht die anderen Teams an, wenn ihr eure Fragen vorlest. Wenn ihr eine Frage nicht versteht, fragt höflich nach. (Wenn ihr die Antwort wisst, behaltet sie zunächst für euch.)

aufgabenstellung.p: Each team reads its questions.
The other teams write the answers.
One student from each team checks the answers at the end and gives the results to the umpire. The umpire says who the winner is.
Can you say that again, please? | Sorry, I didn’t understand that! | Can you speak louder, please?
Did you enjoy the quiz? What was good/not so good about it?

inhalteelement.p: This day is around the birthday of the civil rights activist, Martin Luther King. He lived at a time when African Americans didn’t have the same rights as white Americans. He used peaceful ways to protest against this. American children often learn about Martin Luther King and civil rights at school.

4th July celebrates the USA’s independence from Great Britain in 1776. People wear red, white and blue clothes – like the American flag. They have picnics or barbecues and there are fantastic fireworks everywhere.

Columbus first saw America in 1492. Today people still celebrate the event. Some people don’t like this holiday because Columbus didn’t really discover America. Columbus Day celebrates a man of ideas and dreams. Many countries in South America celebrate Columbus Day too.

The history of Thanksgiving began in 1621 when the Europeans settled and celebrated their first year in their new country. Some local Native Americans invited them to their meal. Thanksgiving is a family day – often with the tradition of a Thanksgiving dinner. Football games are usually a big part of the day too.
civil rights – Bürgerrechte
activist – Aktivist; Aktivistin
to protest – protestieren
flag – Flagge; Fahne
fireworks – Feuerwerk
Thanksgiving – Erntedankfest

loesung.p: The history of Thanksgiving began in 1621 when the Europeans settled and celebrated their first year in their new country. Some local Native Americans invited them to their meal. Thanksgiving is a family day – often with the tradition of a Thanksgiving dinner. Football games are usually a big part of the day too.

This day is around the birthday of the civil rights activist, Martin Luther King. He lived at a time when African Americans didn’t have the same rights as white Americans. He used peaceful ways to protest against this. American children often learn about Martin Luther King and civil rights at school.

4th July celebrates the USA’s independence from Great Britain in 1776. People wear red, white and blue clothes – like the American flag. They have picnics or barbecues and there are fantastic fireworks everywhere.

Columbus first saw America in 1492. Today people still celebrate the event. Some people don’t like this holiday because Columbus didn’t really discover America. Columbus Day celebrates a man of ideas and dreams. Many countries in South America celebrate Columbus Day too.

aufgabe.titel: Choose one text and find more about the topic on the internet (2 or 3 interesting facts).

aufgabenstellung.p: What celebration would you like to take part in? Say why.

li.p: Martin Luther King was shot in 1968. He said “I have a dream” because he wanted to change the life of African Americans in the USA.
At first there were 13 states in the USA. They wrote the Declaration of Independence to announce their independence from Great Britain on 4th July 1776.
Christopher Columbus was from Italy. He wanted to travel to India, but he arrived in the Caribbean.

There is always a lot of traffic before and after Thanksgiving because lots of people visit their families. On Black Friday, after Thanksgiving, you can find a lot of cheap things to buy in the USA. I’d like to take part in Martin Luther King Day because I’d like to learn more about civil rights in the USA./I’d like to take part in Independence Day because I love barbecues and fireworks.

aufgabe.titel: Choose one text and find more about the topic on the internet(2 or 3 interesting facts).

aufgabenstellung.p: Choose one text and say in German what it tells you about the topic.

li.p: Dieser Tag liegt um den Geburtstag von Martin Luther King herum. Er war ein Aktivist für die Bürgerrechte der afroamerikanischen Bevölkerung. Afroamerikaner hatten damals nicht dieselben Rechte wie Weiße und er protestierte friedlich dagegen. Die Schülerinnen und Schüler in den USA lernen etwas über Martin Luther King und Bürgerrechte in der Schule.

Am 4. Juli feiert man die Unabhängigkeit der USA von Großbritannien im Jahr 1776. Die Leute tragen rote, weiße und blaue Kleidung – die Farben der US-amerikanischen Flagge. Sie veranstalten Picknicks und Grillpartys und es gibt überall Feuerwerke.

Am Columbus Day feiern die Menschen in den USA Kolumbus’ Ankunft in Amerika im Jahr 1492. Manche Menschen mögen diesen Feiertag aber nicht, da Kolumbus Amerika nicht wirklich entdeckt hat. An dem Tag wird ein Mann mit vielen Ideen und Träumen gefeiert. Viele Länder in Südamerika feiern diesen Tag auch.

Das erste Erntedankfest war im Jahr 1621, als die Europäer ihr erstes Jahr nach ihrer Ankunft in Amerika feierten. Einige amerikanische Ureinwohner luden sie damals zum Essen ein. Thanksgiving ist heute ein wichtiges Familienfest, an dem Familien ein großes Festessen veranstalten und Football schauen.

loesung.p: My name is Hannah and I’m 14. I live in Orlando, Florida with my parents, my younger brother, Ryan and our cat, Larry. We live in a small house; it has got a kitchen with a small breakfast room, a living room, a bathroom, three bedrooms and a small garden. I like it here.
Can you tell me something about yourself, your family, the place where you live?

aufgabenitem.p: She writes about her favourite activities and hobbies.

loesung.p: My best friends are Leah and Joshua. They are in the same class. After school we often go to the school café. We can chat online there. At the weekends we sometimes go shopping. Occasionally, if it’s warm and sunny, we also go canoeing or rafting on Lake Apopka. That’s always a lot of fun and quite exciting. And what do you do in your free time?

What subjects do you like best? I’m in the school drama club. Next month we will take part in the Orlando theater festival. I’m acting “Juliet” in Shakespeare’s “Romeo and Juliet”. Have you got school clubs in Bavaria too?

What subjects do you like best?
Have you got school clubs in Bavaria too?
And what do you do in your free time?

aufgabenstellung.p: Write a draft of an e-mail.
SUBJECT: First contact
Hi Bastian,
I saw your photo and your profile in Penfriends Worldwide.
I have always wanted to have contact with a boy or girl in Germany because my grandfather came to the USA from Fürth in Bavaria more than 50 years ago. He died when I was five.

My name is Hannah and I’m 14. I live in Orlando, Florida with my parents, my younger brother, Ryan and our cat, Larry. We live in a small house; it has got a kitchen with a small breakfast room, a living room, a bathroom, three bedrooms and a small garden. I like it here.
Can you tell me something about yourself, your family, the place where you live?

I go to the Baker Middle School in Orlando. My school is some miles away from our home so I have to take the bus every day. My favorite subjects are Math and Biology. What subjects do you like best? I’m in the school drama club. Next month we will take part in the Orlando theater festival. I’m acting “Juliet” in Shakespeare’s “Romeo and Juliet”. Have you got school clubs in Bavaria too?

My best friends are Leah and Joshua. They are in the same class. After school we often go to the school café. We can chat online there. At the weekends we sometimes go shopping. Occasionally, if it’s warm and sunny, we also go canoeing or rafting on Lake Apopka. That’s always a lot of fun and quite exciting. And what do you do in your free time?
That’s all for today. Please write soon!
Best wishes
Hannah
Don’t forget to write who you are.

tipp.p: Wenn du den ersten Entwurf schreibst, achte auf die richtige Reihenfolge.

aufgabenstellung.p: Read your draft and think of words like always, often, sometimes, occasionally.

tipp.p: Überprüfe die Rechtschreibung mit einem Wörterbuch/Rechtschreibprogramm.

aufgabenstellung.p: Now write a clean copy of the e-mail.

tipp.p: Schreibe nun deine E-Mail sauber auf, wenn möglich mit dem Computer.

musterloesung.p: Individuelle Lösungen – Beispiel:
SUBJECT: First contact
Hi Hannah,
Thank you for your e-mail.
I’m Sam from Regensburg. It’s a town in Bavaria. I’ve never been to the USA, so it would be really great to have an American friend.

I live in Regensburg with my family. We live in a flat. I have a brother and a sister. I have a cat too. Our part of town is really nice. There is a flea market every Saturday. You can find cool things there.

I go to a big school in Regensburg. It’s not far from our home, so I get to school by bike. There are 25 students in my class. My favorite subjects are Math and IT. I’m in the school basketball club. I go there every Tuesday afternoon. We have an important match soon. I’m really excited!

I’m very interested in sports. Have you ever been to a game of American football or baseball? I also like music and movies. In my free time I often meet my friends at the park or go to the cinema. When we’re on vacation, my family and I sometimes go skiing in the mountains or swimming in the North Sea.
What did you do last weekend? Did you go to any special places?
Please write back soon.
Best wishes
Sam

aufgabenstellung.p: Read a partner’s e-mail and give feedback.

tipp.p: Sage, ob der Aufbau in Ordnung war. Hat er/sie etwas Wichtiges vergessen?

inhalteelement.p: SUBJECT: Coming to Germany
Hi Zeynep,

Thank you very much for letting me stay with you and your family in October. This is very important for me because my mom’s grandfather was from Bavaria. His family moved to Montana when he was three years old. And what’s most important for me: He was born in your town! I will bring an old photo of their house in Bavaria. I hope it’s still there and I can see it.

Thank you very much for the photos of your family, your home and your school. Your mom looks very nice. How old are your brothers? I have a little sister, she is ten years old. We live in a house in Gardiner. Gardiner is a small town in Montana. It is near Yellowstone National Park1. That was the first national park in the United States. It became a national park in 1872. My dad works there as a park ranger. I think it’s the most beautiful park in the USA. There are mountains and rivers, a lot of animals, and also wolves and bears. And there are the geysers2. If you don’t know what geysers are, look on the internet for “Old Faithful”. This is the most famous geyser in the park. Do you have national parks in Germany too? What are the sights in your town?

And I have more questions: I love sports. I’m on the school’s basketball team. What sports teams does your school have? What are your favorite subjects? How do you get to school? Are your teachers nice? My teachers told me about the “Bratwurste”. Is this the right spelling?
That’s all for today. Please write soon.
Best wishes,
Alina
1 Yellowstone National Park – Nationalpark in den USA
2 geyser ['gi:zə] – Geysir, Springquelle

aufgabenitem.p: SUBJECT: Coming to Germany
Hi Zeynep,

Thank you very much for letting me stay with you and your family in October. This is very important for me because my mom’s grandfather was from Bavaria. His family moved to Montana when he was three years old. And what’s most important for me: He was born in your town! I will bring an old photo of their house in Bavaria. I hope it’s still there and I can see it.

Thank you very much for the photos of your family, your home and your school. Your mom looks very nice. How old are your brothers? I have a little sister, she is ten years old. We live in a house in Gardiner. . . My dad works there as a park ranger. . If you don’t know what geysers are, look on the internet for “”. . Do you have national parks in Germany too? What are the sights in your town?

And I have more questions: I love sports. I’m on the school’s basketball team. What sports teams does your school have? What are your favorite subjects? How do you get to school? Are your teachers nice? My teachers told me about the “Bratwurste”. Is this the right spelling?
That’s all for today. Please write soon.
Best wishes,
Alina
1 Yellowstone National Park – Nationalpark in den USA
2 geyser ['gi:zə] – Geysir, Springquelle

loesung.p: Gardiner is a small town in Montana. It is near Yellowstone National Park1.
That was the first national park in the United States. It became a national park in 1872.
I think it’s the most beautiful park in the USA. There are mountains and rivers, a lot of animals, and also wolves and bears. And there are the geysers2.
This is the most famous geyser in the park.

aufgabenstellung.p: Alina has a lot of questions. Underline or highlight the questions. Use a different colour.

aufgabenitem.p: SUBJECT: Coming to Germany
Hi Zeynep,

Thank you very much for letting me stay with you and your family in October. This is very important for me because my mom’s grandfather was from Bavaria. His family moved to Montana when he was three years old. And what’s most important for me: He was born in your town! I will bring an old photo of their house in Bavaria. I hope it’s still there and I can see it.

Thank you very much for the photos of your family, your home and your school. Your mom looks very nice. I have a little sister, she is ten years old. We live in a house in Gardiner. Gardiner is a small town in Montana. It is near Yellowstone National Park1. That was the first national park in the United States. It became a national park in 1872. My dad works there as a park ranger. I think it’s the most beautiful park in the USA. There are mountains and rivers, a lot of animals, and also wolves and bears. And there are the geysers2. If you don’t know what geysers are, look on the internet for “Old Faithful”. This is the most famous geyser in the park.
And I have more questions: I love sports. I’m on the school’s basketball team. My teachers told me about the “Bratwurste”.
That’s all for today. Please write soon.
Best wishes,
Alina
1 Yellowstone National Park – Nationalpark in den USA
2 geyser ['gi:zə] – Geysir, Springquelle

loesung.p: Do you have national parks in Germany too? What are the sights in your town?
What sports teams does your school have? What are your favorite subjects? How do you get to school? Are your teachers nice?

aufgabenstellung.p: How can you answer Alina’s questions? Make a list of ideas in your exercise book.
What do you want to tell her? Write three or four sentences about yourself in your exercise book.

musterloesung.p: Individuelle Lösungen

aufgabenstellung.p: Write a draft of an e-mail. Check if you have answered all of Alina’s questions.

li.p: Benutze „there is/are“ für „es gibt“.
Nicht vergessen: Ort vor Zeit, das ist gescheit („at home today“).
Verbinde die Sätze mit „but“, „because“, „and“ etc.

aufgabenstellung.p: Show your draft to a partner and read your partner’s e-mail. Give him/her feedback.
Now write a clean copy of your e-mail.

musterloesung.p: We are happy that you will … stay with us in October. It will be nice to have another girl in the family. My brothers are often nice but not always! Emre is 16 and Tahir is 19. Your family comes from our town? That’s great! I will ask my friend Josefa about your family’s house. Her grandma’s mother was born here.

My family comes from Turkey. My brothers, my mum and I speak German but my grandparents don’t. Yes, there are national parks in Germany. There are many high mountains and animals. Some years ago there was a bear. Some people were really scared, but I wasn’t.
I have found Old Faithful on the internet. Geysers are amazing!

There are some sights in our town. There are two churches, a little museum and a beautiful valley with a little river. The city of Nürnberg is 40 km away and there’s a big castle and some big museums there. Some people call Nürnberg the ‘city of Bratwürste’. Your spelling is good, but it’s a ‘ü’ not a ‘u’. Our school has a soccer club and a basketball club. My favourite subjects are PE, English and Art. I don’t like Maths. Usually I go to school by bike. Most of our teachers are nice. But they don’t like it when we forget our homework.
Best wishes,
Zeynep

aufgabenstellung.p: Read the blog from a summer camp. Underline the correct answer.

aufgabenitem.p: At the moment I here at the swimming pool in our summer camp. I have tried some new activities. Rafting was at first but after half an hour I got used to it and had a lot of fun. Yesterday we a mountain. the evenings we have a lot of fun by the campfire. The exciting activity was the night walk yesterday evening. It was so dark and we couldn’t see anything. A boy nearly in the river.
I am sorry, I don’t have time because our next activity starts in ten minutes.

aufgabenstellung.p: Fill in the gaps. Use the right form of the words.

aufgabenitem.p: Some of the national parks are in the southwest and the northwest of the United States. Nearly everyone photos of the Grand Canyon. The red rocks fantastic in the morning and in the evening. America’s national park was Yellowstone National Park. The land around the Yellowstone River a national park in 1872. Every national park has a center where park rangers tell you everything about plants, animals and rocks. The thing for tourists is when they see a bear for the first time.

inhalteelement.p: I’m Mike and I’m from New York. I know that sounds cool, but it isn’t.

I don’t know my father. He left my mother before I was born and I have never met him. My mom worked as a shop assistant all day to get some money. But it wasn’t much. We could just pay for our small apartment. At the end of the month I was usually hungry because we had no money for food. And that was really hard.
This is when my life changed and my story starts:

One day I was very hungry. I was walking through the streets and didn’t know what to do. There was a little market with a lot of stalls. I looked at the food, the bread, the cheese and the apples. That was too much for me! I looked around, took an apple and walked away very fast. Suddenly I heard somebody behind me.

He shouted, “Stop!” and I started to run. I ran as fast as I could until he couldn’t see me. I was scared. I waited, but nothing happened. After ten minutes I came out and tried the apple. It was great! Suddenly someone shouted, “Here you are!” and I was scared again.
“Don’t worry, everything is OK. I am the manager of a famous New York football team and I think you should come to our training! We need fast runners.” I didn’t know what to say.
“But first of all, here is some money. Go and pay for that apple!”

Then he was gone. I ran back to the market stall, told them that I was sorry and paid for the apple. Two days later I stood on the football field and practiced with some of New York’s best football players. It was the best day of my life! I am a very fast and strong player so I play for the youth team now. I practice a lot because one day I want to be America’s best football player with lots of money. Then I’ll buy a house for my mother.

aufgabenstellung.p: Answer the questions. Write short answers.

This is when my life changed and my story starts:

One day I was very hungry. I was walking through the streets and didn’t know what to do. There was a little market with a lot of stalls. I looked at the food, the bread, the cheese and the apples. That was too much for me! I looked around, took an apple and walked away very fast. Suddenly I heard somebody behind me.

“Don’t worry, everything is OK. I am the manager of a famous New York football team and I think you should come to our training! We need fast runners.” I didn’t know what to say.

aufgabenstellung.p: You are at a summer camp. Write a message to your parents. Write 8–10 sentences.
Which activities have you already tried? Tell them about three activities.
Which activity did you like best?
Which activity are you going to do tomorrow?
Who are the other boys or girls in your room?
How is the food?
What do you do in the evenings?
How do you like the summer camp?
